entry.dcterms:title: Party Preferences of the Population in Hungary 1992
entry.dcterms:creator: Merkl, Ildikó
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-D68: Party Preferences of the Population in Hungary 1992. data sheet. Version: 2009-04-09
entry.dcterms:creator: Hann, Endre
Tóka, Gábor
entry.dcterms:description: media consumption, economic situation, socio-economic attitudes, religiousness, political interest, trust, current party preferences, voting at the latest parliamentary elections, reasons of sympathy and antipathy towards the six most important parties; satisfaction with the government and democracy
entry.dcterms:subject: elections
psychology
mass media
political institutions, public administration
social behaviour and attitudes
mass political behavior, attitudes
education, school
economic conditions and indicators
religion and values
person
survey data
time-series
Non-institutional custody, a 3% sample of the population aged 18 or more stratified by settlement. Respondents were selected using the Leslie Kish-key in the specific settlement.
Posted self-administered questionnaires.
A
